meanings.definition: The state of being scarce or in short supply.
meanings.sent1: The scarceness of water in the desert made survival difficult.
meanings.sent2: The scarceness of food during the famine led to widespread hunger.
meanings.sent3: The scarceness of parking spots at the mall always makes me late for shopping.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a ray of sunshine in the scarceness of gloomy days.
meanings.sent5: The scarceness of stars in the city sky made her appreciate the beauty of the countryside.

meanings.definition: The quality of being scarce or insufficient.
meanings.sent1: The scarceness of resources in the village affected everyone's daily life.
meanings.sent2: The scarceness of time prevented him from completing all his tasks.
meanings.sent3: His scarceness of jokes at the party made everyone wonder if he was feeling okay.
meanings.sent4: The scarceness of kindness in the world saddened her deeply.
meanings.sent5: The scarceness of colors in the painting gave it a unique and minimalist charm.
